examples: he wooed her with the confident dash of a cavalry officer

definitions.text: a footrace run at top speed
examples: he is preparing for the 100-yard dash

definitions.text: a punctuation mark (-) used between parts of a compound word or between the syllables of a word when the word is divided at the end of a line of text
the longer of the two telegraphic signals used in Morse code
the act of moving with great haste
examples: he made a dash for the door

definitions.text: run or move very quickly or hastily
break into pieces, as by striking or knocking over

examples: He dashed the plate against the wall
Waves were dashing against the rock

definitions.text: add an enlivening or altering element to
